archimate:TechnologyProcess.name: Ingest from a Stream
archimate:TechnologyProcess.documentation: Notice that realtime data exists as "ghost segments" and are still available for query (by announcements) even though they haven't been pushed. If the task fails, therefore, this data might disappear - it is less stable than pushed / published data, and thus is a key reason for replicas for redundancy. These "ghost" segments remain available for query until a historical has fully and completely loaded the segment, meaning that the data will always be available for query without interuption.
